page.title: 20Plasgwernfadog Hotel
page.content: John Player built Plasgwernfadog as a present for his son Percy. Percy lived there with his wife. It was built before 1914 so it is at least seventy years old. The house was built of red sandstone and limestone. The window panes are very small but some of the windows have modern double glazing. I think it spoils the building. They should put the old windows back! Today, Mr. W.Hughes owns the house and uses it as an hotel. He has not changed the interior very much though he has put a bar in the entrance hall for guests. In the dining room there are chandeliers and a church organ. Upstairs there are many bedrooms and I suppose Mr Hughes put the double glazing in to keep the rooms warm and comfortable. The hotel is the only one in the Morriston area.
